definition: An organized whole that is perceived as more than the sum of its parts.
example: The team's performance was a perfect gestalt, superior to individual efforts.
mnemonic: Guess-Tall: The tall guy guessed the WHOLE shape.

definition: Lack of order or predictability; gradual decline into disorder.
example: The system fought against increasing entropy as the code decayed.
mnemonic: Enter-Pea: If a pea enters a clean room, it creates DISORDER.

definition: Proceeding to a solution by trial and error or by rules that are only loosely defined.
example: The AI used a heuristic approach to solve the maze faster.
mnemonic: He-Rips-Stick: He finds a stick to solve the problem (shortcut).

definition: Characterized by recurrence or repetition.
example: The fractal pattern was infinitely recursive.
mnemonic: Re-Curse: You curse again and again (loop).

definition: A typical example or pattern of something; a model.
example: The discovery shifted the scientific paradigm entirely.
mnemonic: Para-Dime: A pair of dimes is a MODEL for wealth.

definition: Lasting for a very short time.
example: Digital data can be surprisingly ephemeral if not backed up.
mnemonic: E-Fem-Oral: Feminine beauty is often called fleeting/ephemeral.

definition: The delay before a transfer of data begins following an instruction.
example: High latency made the neural link feel sluggish.
mnemonic: Late-N-See: You arrive Late and See nothing (delay).

definition: The official procedure or system of rules governing affairs of state or diplomatic occasions.
example: Handshake protocol initiated.
mnemonic: Proto-Call: The FIRST CALL determines the rules.

definition: A process or set of rules to be followed in calculations.
example: The algorithm predicted the stock crash.
mnemonic: Al-Gore-Rhythm: Al Gore dancing to a set of RULES.

definition: Combine (a number of things) into a coherent whole.
example: The implants synthesize sensory data into vision.
mnemonic: Synth-Size: Combine sounds to make a huge SIZE.

definition: Relating to the mental action or process of acquiring knowledge.
example: Cognitive functions remained stable after the upload.
mnemonic: Cog-Native: The Gear (Cog) is NATIVE to the brain.

definition: Lack of harmony among musical notes or ideas.
example: Cognitive dissonance occurred when the simulation failed.
mnemonic: Diss-Son: The son disses his dad creates DISHARMONY.

definition: The process of converting information or data into a code.
example: Military-grade encryption protected the shard.
mnemonic: En-Crypt: Put it IN a CRYPT (hidden).

definition: Divide into two branches or forks.
example: The timeline began to bifurcate after the anomaly.
mnemonic: Bi-Fur-Cat: A cat with TWO fur coats branching off.

definition: A connection or series of connections linking two or more things.
example: The city was the nexus of the dark web.
mnemonic: Next-Us: The thing connecting the person NEXT to US.

definition: Render obscure
example: unclear
etymology: The code was written to obfuscate its true purpose.
mnemonic: Verdunkeln
freq: Ob-Fuss-Kate: Kate made a FUSS to HIDE the truth.

definition: A discrete quantity of energy proportional in magnitude to the frequency of the radiation it represents.
example: Quantum computing changed everything.
mnemonic: Quan-Tom: Tom is a small discrete UNIT.

definition: The quality in a sound of being deep
example: full
etymology: The idea found resonance within the hacker community.
mnemonic: Resonanz
freq: Res-On-Ants: The sound vibrated ON the ANTS.

definition: Interaction between two different organisms living in close physical association.
example: Man and machine achieved perfect symbiosis.
mnemonic: Sim-Bio-Sis: The SIMs and my BIO SISter live together.

definition: The time at which something is most powerful or successful.
example: The corporation reached its zenith in 2077.
mnemonic: Zen-ith: The peak of ZEN is the top.
